revised_title: Advancements in Contraceptive Research and Development
tldr: The article discusses the World Health Organization's Expanded Programme of Research, Development, and Research Training in Human Reproduction, which aims to improve existing methods of fertility regulation and develop new methods. The program involves over 650 scientists from 60 countries researching various contraceptive methods, including pills, injectables, intra-uterine devices, vaginal rings, and more. The research focuses on assessing the safety, effectiveness, and acceptability of these methods in different populations and environments.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Sociology of Health and Medicine
